intro: Flickingeria pristichila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
